pages.text: Eretmorhipis is a small marine reptile from the Triassic period. The animal was rather bizarre, possessing a disproportionately small head with even smaller eyes, a strange fin morphology possessing six fingers, and several dome shaped osteoderms running down the length of the animal's back. Recent studies also reveal that the animal would have had a keratinized platypus-like beak in life, allowing it to lay on the seabed and sift through the sediment, with the help of a whale-like throat pouch
